intro: Ardisia chiriquiensis, commonly known as the Chiriquí silverleaf, is a shrub native to Central America, particularly found in Costa Rica and Panama. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes many evergreen shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and produces small, white to pinkish flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. The fruit is a small, bright red berry that attracts various bird species.
